message.content:
■ 1)  DETAILED ANALYSIS OF THE MAIN TARGET IMAGE  

• Overall Count and Layers  
There are two separate little “tower” structures, using a total of 14 blocks:  
 – Left Structure (10 blocks)  
    1 × large orange cylinder as a central column  
    4 × blue rectangular blocks forming a ring around the cylinder  
    4 × orange triangular wedges arranged around the base  
    1 × orange “roof” wedge perched on top  
 – Right Structure (4 blocks)  
    2 × orange cylinders forming two columns  
    1 × yellow rectangular bar laid horizontally across the two columns  
    1 × orange wedge set on top of the bar  

In terms of “layers”: both structures can be seen as roughly three layers tall (base‐level blocks, mid‐level block(s), and a top wedge).  

• Spatial Relationships  
 – Left Tower:  
    – A single orange cylinder stands upright.  
    – Around the midpoint of that cylinder, four small blue rectangular blocks form a square “ring.”  
    – Four orange wedges rest on the ground around the cylinder, leaning up to meet the blue ring.  
    – Another orange wedge (“roof”) sits on top of the cylinder.  
 – Right Tower:  
    – Two orange cylinders stand vertically as columns.  
    – A long yellow rectangular bar bridges across their tops.  
    – A single orange wedge is centered on top of the bar.  

■ 2)  SELECTING FROM THE DICTIONARY  

Blocks Required (with exact dictionary indices and orientations):

• For the Left Structure  
  – Orange cylinder (#7) used once  
  – Blue rectangular block (#2) used four times (these are the horizontally oriented small blue blocks that form the ring)  
  – Orange wedges around the base: #13, #14, #15, #16 (one for each side, each has its own orientation in the dictionary)  
  – Orange “roof” wedge (#9) used once on top  

• For the Right Structure  
  – Orange cylinder (#7) used twice (the two columns)  
  – Yellow rectangular bar (#3) used once (spans the two columns)  
  – Orange “roof” wedge (#9) used once (on top of the bar)  

Hence the complete set of dictionary indices is:  
{2×4, 3, 7×3, 9×2, 13, 14, 15, 16}.  

■ 3)  STEP‐BY‐STEP ASSEMBLY SEQUENCE

Below is one logical order in which to place/move these blocks (you may of course group or order them slightly differently, but this shows one clear top‐to‐bottom approach):

{
  Step1: Move block with index 7          (Place the orange cylinder for the left tower)
  Step2: Move block with index 2          (First blue ring block around the cylinder)
  Step3: Move block with index 2          (Second blue ring block)
  Step4: Move block with index 2          (Third blue ring block)
  Step5: Move block with index 2          (Fourth blue ring block)
  Step6: Move block with index 13         (First orange wedge at the base)
  Step7: Move block with index 14         (Second orange wedge)
  Step8: Move block with index 15         (Third orange wedge)
  Step9: Move block with index 16         (Fourth orange wedge)
  Step10: Move block with index 9         (Orange roof wedge on top of the cylinder)
  Step11: Move block with index 7         (First orange cylinder for the right tower)
  Step12: Move block with index 7         (Second orange cylinder for the right tower)
  Step13: Move block with index 3         (Yellow bar spanning the two right-tower cylinders)
  Step14: Move block with index 9         (Orange wedge on top of the yellow bar)
}
